wikipedia_page.main: Waller Rodwell Wright (1775 – 20 April 1826) was an English barrister, author and diplomat. His best-known work was the poem Horæ Ionicæ. He was British consul-general for the republic of the Seven Islands (Ionian Islands) from 1800 to 1804.

response: *April 20 – Waller Rodwell Wright, English diplomat and poet (born 1775)
